intro: Cyrtandra × kaneoheensis, commonly known as the Kāneʻohe hybrid, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in native forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
